creditline: Lent by the Wang Xing Lou Collection
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: blue and white ewer, raised design elements, banding of body and neck, scrolled handle, bubbled band at neck; has own storage box
medium: Porcelain with cobalt blue decoration under clear glaze
text: The distinctive shape of this ewer, which is found both with and without a handle, is probably derived from European metalwork. It is termed in Chinese, <I>hua-chiao<I> or flower waterer but its use was undoubtedly decorative. As with several previous dynasties, the Ch'ing court was interested in certain types of foreign taste and fashion, especially silver and gold metalwork.
title: Blue and White Ewer (huajiao)
